sub_title: International Business student at Avans University of Applied Sciences.
summary:
As a recent graduate of International Business from Avans University of Applied Sciences, I have a passion for creative, innovative, and sustainable solutions that can benefit both the planet and the people. I have gained valuable communication, management, and research skills from my education and internships.

In my most recent role as an Online Marketing Intern at Etrias, an e-commerce platform, I helped increase the online visibility and sales of various products, using SEO, Google Analytics, and social media strategies. I also collaborated with the product development team to provide feedback and suggestions on how to improve the customer experience and satisfaction.

Previously, I worked as a Research Intern at AgroFair, a fair trade organization that supports small-scale farmers in developing countries. AgroFair is a Dutch company importing fair trade tropical fruits, such as bananas or coconuts, into the European market. I conducted market research and analysis on the potential of organic and biodynamic bananas in Europe.

One of my proudest achievements was co-founding PimpMyPlanet.com, a project that aimed to find an alternative to single-use plastic cutlery. With the help of an inspiring team, I developed prototypes of edible and compostable cutlery made of bioplastic from local potatoes destined to end in waste. This project showcased my creativity, entrepreneurial spirit, and environmental awareness.

I am eager to learn from and connect with other professionals who share my vision and values. You can reach me at lukameenink@gmail.com or on LinkedIn.

projects.title: Country selection
projects.description:
The environment in which organizations function is continually changing. This means that to survive organizations have to change themselves and keep on changing. This process involves making strategic decisions which impact the organisation and stakeholders outside the organization. During this semester course, I gained an understanding of the strategic decision making process which organizations make and the forces influencing these decisions. I acquired the necessary knowledge to realise that decisions
made at a corporate level will only be successful if they are translated into actions at divisional and operational levels within the organization.
The Stategic Business Decisions project is different than the other study years. It is interdisciplinary, integrated and aligned. Case studies play a pivotal role in SBD and allow students to simulate making strategic decisions and evaluate effect. Next to a profit-orientation, special attention is given to
people and planet throughout this semester. The intention of this semester course (20
weeks) is to consolidate and build on the knowledge I have acquired throughout the
past three years.

Throughout this project, I was able to understand: 
- The interdependence of the different disciplines within an organization.
- The importance of taking a balanced approach to strategic decisions.
- The interdependence between the different levels within organizations and the possible synergies that can be obtained from a suitable management of organizational change.

Additionally, I was able to assess the financial effects of organizational change while finding the balance between profit, people and planet.

contributors.headline: International Business student at Avans University of Applied Sciences.

projects.title: International Social Entreprenurship
projects.description:
The International Social Entrepreneurship project has contributed to becoming an International Business professional by understanding, analyzing and developing strategies for international business expansion with a strong sustainable approach.
I was involved in a consulting role with a real micro-company (Xmucane, Mexico) in other countries developing international expansion plans.
I was requiered to apply the acquired knowledge from the last 3 years in order to create a realistic approach to all the areas of the business and be able to coach entrepreneurs in an international environment. 

Throughout this project I was able to :
- Unpack the conceptual basis for ‘sustainability’, ‘social entrepreneurship’ and ‘sustainable development” in order to develop a strategic approach to sustainable social business practices.
- Explore the nature of leadership in the context of risk, complexity and uncertainty, multicultural collaboration and the individual, organizational and contextual characteristics in order to facilitate positive responses to social sustainability challenges.
- Examine how an organization’s corporate social responsibility program resources can be deployed more effectively to achieve improved  performance.
- Engage with sustainable operational practices, exploring the concepts to implement and communicate different approaches on an international business context.
- Focus on policies and regulation to address Sustainable Development Goals, climate change and enable the transition to a low carbon and social focused economy in order to create socially responsible business plans.
- Analyse corporate expansion modes and mechanisms to generate the best long term social responsibility strategy.

contributors.headline: International Business student at Avans University of Applied Sciences.

projects.title: Business Expansion
projects.description: The business expansion project consisted of creating a business plan destined for a dutch start-up company in the apparel industry. A robust analysis of the company has been made in order to allow a better understanding of the company's practices and where it stands within this industry saturated by the competition of other brands and copycats. From this point, a new expansion strategy was developed for the selected country taking into account the necessary elements in terms of marketing (4Ps), finance (profit and loss statement forecasts), supply chain (sourcing, logistics, etc.), and human resources (McKinsey's 7S model).
